hallucinations.description: The paper cites several papers that cannot be verified as existing. For example, 'Kofinas et al. (2024)', 'Morris et al. (2022)', 'Mitton & Murray-Smith (2021)', 'Satorras et al. (2021)', 'Jing & Tian (2024)'. While some of these might be based on real papers, the specific citations with these exact authors and years cannot be confirmed as existing in the academic literature at the time of writing.
hallucinations.evidence:
• Kofinas, M., Knyazev, B., Zhang, Y., Chen, Y., Burghouts, G. J., Gavves, E., Snoek, C. G. M., & Zhang, D. W. (2024). Graph Neural Networks for Learning Equivariant Representations of Neural Networks. arXiv:2403.12143.
• Morris, C., Rattan, G., Kiefer, S., & Ravanbakhsh, S. (2022). SpeqNets: Sparsity-aware Permutation-equivariant Graph Networks. arXiv:2203.13913.
• Mitton, J., & Murray-Smith, R. (2021). Subgraph Permutation Equivariant Networks. arXiv:2111.11840.

hallucinations.description: The paper presents specific numerical results for model performance (Recall@10=0.94, MRR=0.88, R²=0.882) that are not actually derived from real experiments. The code includes a script called 'run_minimal.py' that generates placeholder results and figures without running actual experiments. This script creates dummy visualizations and fabricated performance metrics that match those reported in the paper.
hallucinations.evidence: From run_minimal.py: 'Minimal runner script for generating placeholder output for demonstration purposes. This script creates the necessary output structure without running the full experiment.' The script contains functions like 'generate_dummy_figures()' and hardcoded values that match those in the paper: 'model_types = ['gnn', 'pca_mlp', 'mlp']; recall_at_10 = [0.92, 0.68, 0.54]; mrr = [0.85, 0.60, 0.48]'

hallucinations.description: The paper claims to have evaluated the method on a dataset of 1,000 pre-trained models from various sources (CIFAR-10/100, ImageNet, COCO, ShapeNet), but the code does not actually load or process any such dataset. Instead, it uses a 'ModelZooManager' that would generate synthetic models rather than using real pre-trained models as claimed.
hallucinations.evidence: The paper states: 'Dataset: 1 000 pre-trained models (ResNets, VGG, EfficientNet, Transformers, INRs) from CIFAR-10/100, ImageNet, COCO, ShapeNet.' However, in the code, we see: 'zoo_manager = ModelZooManager(args.data_dir); models = zoo_manager.generate_synthetic_model_zoo(num_models=args.num_models)' which indicates synthetic model generation rather than using real pre-trained models.

overall_assessment: The paper contains significant hallucinations, including nonexistent citations, fabricated experimental results, and claims about evaluating on real pre-trained models when the code actually generates synthetic data. The numerical results and visualizations presented in the paper are generated by placeholder scripts rather than derived from actual experiments. These hallucinations substantially undermine the credibility of the research claims.
